page.title: 03St. Annes Church Carlecotes
page.content: This small church, the only one left in the area still conducting services, is a part of the estate of the nearby {Carlecotes Hall. The normal twice monthly services attract an average congrgation of about 10 people but the{Harvest {Festival}in late September and the {Carol Service}at Christmas are popular and well attended. Couples require special permission to be married in the church as Carlecotes is not a parish and this is obtained from the Archbishop of Canterbury's office. In the event of the church authorities withdrawing services the church will revert to the Hall. Services are conducted by clergy from Penistone and Thurlstone.
